text: The Costume Designers Guild Award for Excellent in Period Film is one of the annual awards given by the Costume Designers Guild. The 1998 inaugural awards year combined period, fantasy and contemporary films. Movies marked with a dagger (‡) were nominees for the Academy Award for Best Costume Design. == 1990s == {| class="wikitable" width="95%" cellpadding="5" |- ! width="10%" | Year ! width="45%" | Film ! width="45%" | Costume Designer(s) |- | rowspan="5" style="text-align:center;"| 1998 || style="background:#FAEB86;" | Pleasantville || style="background:#FAEB86;" | Judianna Makovsky ‡ |- | Beloved || Colleen Atwood ‡ |- | The Man in the Iron Mask || James Acheson |- | The Mask of Zorro || Graciela Mazón |- | The Truman Show || Marilyn Matthews |} ==Winners and Nominees for Contemporary Film== ===1990s=== {| class="wikitable" width="95%" cellpadding="5" |- ! width="10%" | Year ! width="45%" | Film ! width="45%" | Costume Designer(s) |- | rowspan="4" style="text-align:center;"| 1999 || style="background:#FAEB86;" | American Beauty || style="background:#FAEB86;" | Julie Weiss |- | Cookie's Fortune || Dona Granata |- | Eyes Wide Shut || Marit Allen |- | Fight Club || Michael Kaplan |} ===2000s=== {| class="wikitable" width="95%" cellpadding="5" |- ! width="10%" | Year ! width="45%" | Film ! width="45%" | Costume Designer(s) |- | rowspan="5" style="text-align:center;"| 2000 || style="background:#FAEB86;" | Erin Brockovich || style="background:#FAEB86;" | Jeffrey Kurland |- | Charlie's Angels || Joseph G.
